The severity seems mild to moderate with no signs of vision impairment or systemic illness, suggesting routine urgency. Differential considerations include allergic or infectious conjunctivitis, but trauma is most consistent here. An evidence-based approach involves symptomatic management, symptomatic reassurance, and monitoring for any signs of secondary infection or complications. Initial management focuses on symptom relief and reassurance while observing for any deterioration or signs of infection, with a long-term strategy emphasizing eye protection and prompt follow-up if symptoms worsen.
